column4: Hello. I installed Ubuntu on my laptop this afternoon from a USB key courtesy of unetbootin. However, my new install will now not boot without the USB key being present. How do I fix this?
I guess I need to adjust the grub config and re-install it on my / partition.
grub goes on your boot sector not your / partition
OK. Well, right now it seems to be on the USB key.
If the laptop has the USB key plugged in, it boots. If it does not have it plugged in, it does not ('Error 24' at stage 1.5, IIRC).
OK. How do I fix it?
install grub to the mbr of your root hard disk
Do I have to adjust the hd(X,X) points?
what ever your root file system is
is ubuntu installed on the usb stick
I have no idea how I find out what the correct numbers are for grub.
if you open your /boot/grub/device.map you'll see the hd->/dev mapping
How do I install grub on a given device?
check out the link from ubottu
